body:
Hello! Super excited by this work, and am experimenting with it both in a personal and a professional capacity. However, Helm doesn't seem to be able to deploy third party resources, though `$ kubectl` can. Steps to reproduce are below:

```
$ # This is the only thing in the templates directory
$ cat templates/40-howden-io.certificate.yml 

---
apiVersion: "stable.k8s.psg.io/v1"
kind: "Certificate"
metadata:
  name: "howden-io"
  namespace: "howden-io"
spec:
  domain: "howden.io"
  email: "[REMOVED]"
  provider: "route53"
  secretName: "tls-howden-io"

# See
$ ls templates/
40-howden-io.certificate.yml  NOTES.txt

# Helm doesn't seem to like this third party resource
$ helm install . --name=howden-io
Error: release howden-io failed: unable to decode "": no kind "Certificate" is registered for version "stable.k8s.psg.io/v1"

# kubectl handles the certificate OK
$ kubectl apply -f templates/40-howden-io.certificate.yml 
certificate "howden-io" created

# Helm also doesn't like the deletion of the certificate
$ helm delete --purge howden-io
Error: deletion error count 2: no objects visited; unable to decode "": no kind "Certificate" is registered for version "stable.k8s.psg.io/v1"

```

Note: Mildly edited for content, clarity. Versions and things:

```
$ kubectl version
Client Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"4", GitVersion:"v1.4.4", GitCommit:"3b417cc4ccd1b8f38ff9ec96bb50a81ca0ea9d56", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2016-10-21T02:48:38Z", GoVersion:"go1.6.3", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
Server Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"4", GitVersion:"v1.4.4", GitCommit:"3b417cc4ccd1b8f38ff9ec96bb50a81ca0ea9d56", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2016-10-21T02:42:39Z", GoVersion:"go1.6.3", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}

$ helm version
Client: &version.Version{SemVer:"v2.0.0-beta.1", GitCommit:"05c04bccae63c6392ec0cb0e27790650167279f0", GitTreeState:"clean"}
Server: &version.Version{SemVer:"v2.0.0-beta.1", GitCommit:"05c04bccae63c6392ec0cb0e27790650167279f0", GitTreeState:"clean"}
```

The third party resource in question

```
apiVersion: v1
items:
- apiVersion: extensions/v1beta1
  description: A specification of a Let's Encrypt Certificate to manage.
  kind: ThirdPartyResource
  metadata:
    creationTimestamp: [REMOVED]
    name: certificate.stable.k8s.psg.io
    resourceVersion: " [REMOVED]"
    selfLink: /apis/extensions/v1beta1/thirdpartyresources/certificate.stable.k8s.psg.io
    uid: [REMOVED]
  versions:
  - name: v1
kind: List
metadata: {}
```
title: Helm choking with third party resources.
